channel.title: Starting a server problem
channel.description:
Hello, me and my brother have recently decided to begin coding our own server. He's been studying java languages (something about c++, and other stuff, i'm not sure what it's called exactly.), and I'm working so I can provide payment for a website, vps, etc. We've been trying to Get our server online and accessible by players before we start coding it, but we've hit a road bump.
I've found a source I want, code for client+server is fine, I've gotten both compilers working correctly. I've port forwarded my router, which is linksys by cisco. I've added inbound and outbound rules in my windows firewall for port 43594(port our server uses.) I've registered a no-ip, and created an account, added a host with the chosen ip of my server.
Still, no one can connect via the IP. I can connect on the same computer the server is being run on via the 127.0.0.1 ip, but not with the no-ip i created.
I'm running windows 7, I have norton antivirus, and cox highspeed internet. Not sure what else you would need to help me, but i'll provide it asap if you ask for it.
I'd appreciate any help I can get.
Thanks in advance.

item.title: Starting a server problem
item.dc:creator: @0wn4g3sc4p3 0wn4g3sc4p3
item.description:
@0wn4g3sc4p3 wrote:

Hello, me and my brother have recently decided to begin coding our own server. He’s been studying java languages (something about c++, and other stuff, i’m not sure what it’s called exactly.), and I’m working so I can provide payment for a website, vps, etc. We’ve been trying to Get our server online and accessible by players before we start coding it, but we’ve hit a road bump.

I’ve found a source I want, code for client+server is fine, I’ve gotten both compilers working correctly.
I’ve port forwarded my router, which is linksys by cisco.
I’ve added inbound and outbound rules in my windows firewall for port 43594(port our server uses.)
I’ve registered a no-ip, and created an account, added a host with the chosen ip of my server.

Still, no one can connect via the IP.
I can connect on the same computer the server is being run on via the 127.0.0.1 ip, but not with the no-ip i created.

I’m running windows 7, I have norton antivirus, and cox highspeed internet.
Not sure what else you would need to help me, but i’ll provide it asap if you ask for it.

I’d appreciate any help I can get.

Thanks in advance.
